item.title: Sheriff’s office investigates death after a man was found off Siesta Key Beach
item.description: Investigators were told that an unresponsive male swimmer was found on Siesta Key. The swimmer was pulled from the gulf by passersby.

item.description: The victim was found with a gunshot wound to the head.

item.title: Punta Gorda synagogue fire investigated as arson, possible hate crime
item.description: “We have allotted extra resources to be in the area to help protect our Punta Gorda Jewish community.”

item.title: Deadline to apply for Florida bear hunt permits ends tonight
item.description: The deadline to apply for a 2025 bear harvest permit is 11:59 p.m. tonight.

item.title: VIDEO: Bradenton, Tampa authorities report citizens hitting helicopters with lasers
item.description: Laser strikes on aircraft remain a serious threat to safety, the FAA says.

item.title: Bradenton Police looking for female suspect in Dollar Tree robbery
item.description: Police say they are looking for Adrian Randall after evidence linked her to the crime.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel to be reinstated after suspension over Charlie Kirk comments, ABC says
item.description: Jimmy Kimmel will be reinstated after his suspension following his Charlie Kirk comments, ABC says.

item.title: Two injured when car crashes into laundromat near Bahia Vista and U.S. 41
item.description: Investigators say the driver pressed the gas instead of the brake and drove into the business.

item.title: What’s up with these recent sunsets?
item.description: Many drivers are having a hard time driving during sunrise and sunset recently.
